page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: There are 9 farms in the block:2 dairy,6 mixed and 1 arable.3 are owner farmed,6 rented farms:2 owned by Mt. Edgcumbe,1 Antony Estates,1 C.E.G.B,2 private owners.The mixed farms breed and fatten sheep,bullocks,pigs and poultry.The largest dairy farm has 100 cows averaging 6000 litres of milk per cow annually.The milk is collected by tanker and taken to Plymouth Co-op Dairy.Crops grown are-arable and mixed farms-wheat,barley,oats,potatoes, swedes,oil seed rape,hay and silage. The Millbrook market garden-glasshouse crops-tomatoes,strawberries,early salad crops,garden crops:beans,onions, salad crops.Summer 1985.Land usage in block:Residential 6% Derelict land 2% Crops other than grass 15%:Hay/Silage 35% Hillside grass 19% Woodland- Conifers 3% Deciduous 1% Uncultivated 3% Inland water 13% sea 3%.
